rev.comment: rm per character fair use images per [[WP:NFLISTS]]
rev.diff:
Line 8: Line 8:
==Ganos Lal/Morgan le Fay==
==Ganos Lal/Morgan le Fay==
â
[[Image:Ganos Lal.jpg|thumb|Morgan le Fay posing as a hologram in "The Pegasus Project"]]
 
[[Sarah Strange]] played '''Ganos Lal''', an [[Ascension (Stargate)|ascended]] [[Ancient (Stargate)|Ancient]] who gave rise to the [[Arthurian legend]] of '''[[Morgan le Fay]]'''. In the ''Stargate'' mythology, she was originally an inhabitant of the Ancient city of [[Atlantis (Stargate)|Atlantis]], where a holographic learning program based on her image taught Lantean children about Ancient technology, history and science. When it became clear that the Ancients had been defeated by the [[Wraith (Stargate)|Wraith]], she fled back to [[Tau'ri|Earth]] with the other surviving Ancients and secluded herself in meditation until her ascension. When fellow ascended Ancient [[Moros (Stargate)|Moros]] (Merlin, Myrddin) descended in order to construct a weapon to fight the [[Ori (Stargate)|Ori]] that could be used against the Ancients themselves, Morgan le Fay was assigned to watch him and, if necessary, prevent his completion of the weapon. Like Myrddin, she eventually came to believe that the Ori could some day become a threat to the Ancients themselves.<ref name="The Pegasus Project" /> Morgan eventually found the Sangraal, which Myrddin had hidden in another dimension. She hid it on a planet where it would be safe from both the Ori and the Ancients, and protected the Sangraal with Ancient riddles and challenges. She also put Merlin in stasis to wait for the one day when he would rebuild it after she was forced to destroy the original.<ref name="The Quest">"[[The Quest (Stargate SG-1)|The Quest]]" (''[[Stargate SG-1]]'')</ref>
[[Sarah Strange]] played '''Ganos Lal''', an [[Ascension (Stargate)|ascended]] [[Ancient (Stargate)|Ancient]] who gave rise to the [[Arthurian legend]] of '''[[Morgan le Fay]]'''. In the ''Stargate'' mythology, she was originally an inhabitant of the Ancient city of [[Atlantis (Stargate)|Atlantis]], where a holographic learning program based on her image taught Lantean children about Ancient technology, history and science. When it became clear that the Ancients had been defeated by the [[Wraith (Stargate)|Wraith]], she fled back to [[Tau'ri|Earth]] with the other surviving Ancients and secluded herself in meditation until her ascension. When fellow ascended Ancient [[Moros (Stargate)|Moros]] (Merlin, Myrddin) descended in order to construct a weapon to fight the [[Ori (Stargate)|Ori]] that could be used against the Ancients themselves, Morgan le Fay was assigned to watch him and, if necessary, prevent his completion of the weapon. Like Myrddin, she eventually came to believe that the Ori could some day become a threat to the Ancients themselves.<ref name="The Pegasus Project" /> Morgan eventually found the Sangraal, which Myrddin had hidden in another dimension. She hid it on a planet where it would be safe from both the Ori and the Ancients, and protected the Sangraal with Ancient riddles and challenges. She also put Merlin in stasis to wait for the one day when he would rebuild it after she was forced to destroy the original.<ref name="The Quest">"[[The Quest (Stargate SG-1)|The Quest]]" (''[[Stargate SG-1]]'')</ref>
Line 15: Line 14:
==<span id="Moros"/><span id="Merlin"/>Moros/Myrddin/Merlin==
==<span id="Moros"/><span id="Merlin"/>Moros/Myrddin/Merlin==
â
[[Image:Moros - Before I Sleep (Stargate Atlantis).jpg|thumb|Moros in "Before I Sleep"]]
 
Played by [[Matthew Walker (Canadian actor)|Matthew Walker]], '''Moros''', also known as '''Myrddin''' or '''Merlin''', was the High Councilor of [[Atlantis (Stargate)|Atlantis]] during the days of the first siege of the city, and one of the most influential Ancients in the series. Although most of his backstory is revealed through story reconstruction, Myrddin appears several times before SG-1 finally meet him in person. Myrddin is introduced in the ''Atlantis'' episode "[[Before I Sleep (Stargate Atlantis)|Before I Sleep]]", where an alternate [[Elizabeth Weir (Stargate)|Elizabeth Weir]] meets him as Moros when he was still living on Atlantis.<ref name="Before I Sleep">"[[Before I Sleep (Stargate Atlantis)|Before I Sleep]]" (''[[Stargate Atlantis]]'')</ref> A visual record of him still remains in the Atlantis database.<ref name="The Pegasus Project" /> Myrddin also appears as a Merlin [[hologram]] to SG-1, giving them information about his background and his motivations.<ref name="Avalon" /><ref name="Camelot" /> Moros is named after [[Moros]] from Greek legend, the personification of impending doom and destruction, while his name [[Merlin (wizard)|Merlin]] refers to the [[Arthurian legend]]. Matthew Walker was nominated for a [[Leo Award]] in 2007 for "Best Supporting Performance by a Male in a Dramatic Series" for this role.<ref>[http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0908022/awards Matthew Walker (I) - Awards<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
Played by [[Matthew Walker (Canadian actor)|Matthew Walker]], '''Moros''', also known as '''Myrddin''' or '''Merlin''', was the High Councilor of [[Atlantis (Stargate)|Atlantis]] during the days of the first siege of the city, and one of the most influential Ancients in the series. Although most of his backstory is revealed through story reconstruction, Myrddin appears several times before SG-1 finally meet him in person. Myrddin is introduced in the ''Atlantis'' episode "[[Before I Sleep (Stargate Atlantis)|Before I Sleep]]", where an alternate [[Elizabeth Weir (Stargate)|Elizabeth Weir]] meets him as Moros when he was still living on Atlantis.<ref name="Before I Sleep">"[[Before I Sleep (Stargate Atlantis)|Before I Sleep]]" (''[[Stargate Atlantis]]'')</ref> A visual record of him still remains in the Atlantis database.<ref name="The Pegasus Project" /> Myrddin also appears as a Merlin [[hologram]] to SG-1, giving them information about his background and his motivations.<ref name="Avalon" /><ref name="Camelot" /> Moros is named after [[Moros]] from Greek legend, the personification of impending doom and destruction, while his name [[Merlin (wizard)|Merlin]] refers to the [[Arthurian legend]]. Matthew Walker was nominated for a [[Leo Award]] in 2007 for "Best Supporting Performance by a Male in a Dramatic Series" for this role.<ref>[http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0908022/awards Matthew Walker (I) - Awards<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
Line 23: Line 21:
==Oma Desala==
==Oma Desala==
â
[[Image:Meridian Oma.jpg|thumb|Oma Desala in "[[Meridian (Stargate SG-1)|Meridian]]"]]
 
Played by [[Carla Boudreau]] and [[Mel Harris]], '''Oma Desala''' ("Mother Nature") is an [[Ascension (Stargate)|ascended]] being who goes against the ways of the [[Ancient (Stargate)|Ancients]]. It is unclear if she is an [[Ancient (Stargate)|Ancient]] herself, as the Ancients [[Orlin]] and [[Moros (Stargate)|Merlin]] give different accounts of knowing Oma but it is likely as Merlin has a knowledge of her actions and he's over ten thousand years old.<ref name="Ascension" /><ref name="The Quest, Part II">[[The Quest (Stargate SG-1)|The Quest, Part II]]" (''[[Stargate SG-1]]'')</ref> Although Oma once made the great mistake of helping the fallen [[System Lord]] [[Anubis (Stargate)|Anubis]] ascend and is now banished by the Ancients,<ref name="Threads">"[[Threads (Stargate SG-1)|Threads]]" (''[[Stargate SG-1]]'')</ref> Oma is still convinced of her responsibility to guide those beneath to the "Great Path" of enlightenment, even if this interferes in the lower planes of existence.<ref name="Ascension">"[[Ascension (Stargate SG-1)|Ascension]]" (''[[Stargate SG-1]]'')</ref> She and her followers walk a fine line between going against the wishes of the other Ancients and maintaining their rules enough to not bring down their wrath.<ref name="Full Circle">"[[Full Circle (Stargate SG-1)|Full Circle]]" (''[[Stargate SG-1]]'')</ref> Oma therefore only guides individuals to the path, leaving the final decision to travel the great path to them.<ref name="Meridian">"[[Meridian (Stargate SG-1)|Meridian]]" (''[[Stargate SG-1]]'')</ref>
Played by [[Carla Boudreau]] and [[Mel Harris]], '''Oma Desala''' ("Mother Nature") is an [[Ascension (Stargate)|ascended]] being who goes against the ways of the [[Ancient (Stargate)|Ancients]]. It is unclear if she is an [[Ancient (Stargate)|Ancient]] herself, as the Ancients [[Orlin]] and [[Moros (Stargate)|Merlin]] give different accounts of knowing Oma but it is likely as Merlin has a knowledge of her actions and he's over ten thousand years old.<ref name="Ascension" /><ref name="The Quest, Part II">[[The Quest (Stargate SG-1)|The Quest, Part II]]" (''[[Stargate SG-1]]'')</ref> Although Oma once made the great mistake of helping the fallen [[System Lord]] [[Anubis (Stargate)|Anubis]] ascend and is now banished by the Ancients,<ref name="Threads">"[[Threads (Stargate SG-1)|Threads]]" (''[[Stargate SG-1]]'')</ref> Oma is still convinced of her responsibility to guide those beneath to the "Great Path" of enlightenment, even if this interferes in the lower planes of existence.<ref name="Ascension">"[[Ascension (Stargate SG-1)|Ascension]]" (''[[Stargate SG-1]]'')</ref> She and her followers walk a fine line between going against the wishes of the other Ancients and maintaining their rules enough to not bring down their wrath.<ref name="Full Circle">"[[Full Circle (Stargate SG-1)|Full Circle]]" (''[[Stargate SG-1]]'')</ref> Oma therefore only guides individuals to the path, leaving the final decision to travel the great path to them.<ref name="Meridian">"[[Meridian (Stargate SG-1)|Meridian]]" (''[[Stargate SG-1]]'')</ref>
Line 33: Line 30:
==Orlin==
==Orlin==
â
[[Image:Orlinstargate.jpg|thumb|[[Sean Patrick Flanery]] as Orlin in "[[Ascension (Stargate SG-1)|Ascension]]"]]
 
'''Orlin''', played by [[Sean Patrick Flanery]], is an outcast [[Ancient (Stargate)|Ancient]]. He was forced to remain on the dead planet [[Velona]] for breaking the rules of the Ancients by giving advanced technology to the planet's people, who immediately abused it. When [[SG-1]] research the weapon in "[[Ascension (Stargate SG-1)|Ascension]]", Orlin is immediately taken with Major Carter and leaves the planet with SG-1, concealed in an [[invisibility|invisible]] form. He shows himself to Carter the next morning at her house, but no-one at the SGC believes Carter's story. Orlin later informs Carter of his backstory, and returns to his former human state in the hope of spending the rest of his life with her, giving up his powers as an ascended. When the [[NID (Stargate)|NID]] eventually moves in on Carter's house weeks later, Orlin escapes through a [[Stargate (device)|Stargate]] that he has built in Carter's basement. Back at Velona, Orlin attempts to stop the Tau'ri research of the weapon and is shot by a member of SG-16. The Ancients believe him redeemed and re-ascend him, allowing him to prevent another catastrophe.<ref name="Ascension" />
'''Orlin''', played by [[Sean Patrick Flanery]], is an outcast [[Ancient (Stargate)|Ancient]]. He was forced to remain on the dead planet [[Velona]] for breaking the rules of the Ancients by giving advanced technology to the planet's people, who immediately abused it. When [[SG-1]] research the weapon in "[[Ascension (Stargate SG-1)|Ascension]]", Orlin is immediately taken with Major Carter and leaves the planet with SG-1, concealed in an [[invisibility|invisible]] form. He shows himself to Carter the next morning at her house, but no-one at the SGC believes Carter's story. Orlin later informs Carter of his backstory, and returns to his former human state in the hope of spending the rest of his life with her, giving up his powers as an ascended. When the [[NID (Stargate)|NID]] eventually moves in on Carter's house weeks later, Orlin escapes through a [[Stargate (device)|Stargate]] that he has built in Carter's basement. Back at Velona, Orlin attempts to stop the Tau'ri research of the weapon and is shot by a member of SG-16. The Ancients believe him redeemed and re-ascend him, allowing him to prevent another catastrophe.<ref name="Ascension" />
